question: I recently went swimming, and about a day and a half later I awoke from my sleep about 2 a.m. from a "faint tingling" in my legs.  Its not so much a pain, but rather more of a frustration.  The next day after experiencing the first "tingling," (2 days after swimming) the tingling is still there and also a feeling of my legs wanting to fall asleep.  Is this "tingling" from swimming or should I be concerned about a major health problem (diabetes, etc...)?  This is the first time I have swam in about three years.  I used to swim competitively, but have not done so until this past time.  I am thinking its just my legs having an effect from the kicking in not having done it in such a long time.  Please respond as soon as possible.  I am really worried.  this is the first time this has happened.Facts about me:  20 Years old around 230 lbs. (bodybuilder physique) 6 feet tall, Hispanic Male, Grandfather on mother's side did have diabetes.  Mother does not.
title: Tingling legs
